newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysian stocks drop 1.50 pct on cash calls.
newsitem.headline: Malaysian stocks drop 1.50 pct on cash calls.

text.p: Malaysian stock prices continued to spiral lower, dropping 1.5 percent near midday as cash calls from overlevereaged investors and poor sentiment continued to undermine the market, dealers said.
At 0359 GMT, the Composite Index of leading stocks slipped 16.52 points or 1.52 percent to 1,070.15.
"People are still short and hedge funds are still active," said an equity analyst at a foreign firm. "There are still a number of margin calls being made."
